alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:22PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Uintah County through 415 PM MDT... At 322 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Fort Duchesne, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Randlett. This includes U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 124 and 136, and between mile markers 160 and 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
